content: lapland blanket crochet design by anna nikipirowicz level yarn abbreviations west yorkshire spinners retreat chunky roving * indicates the start of a longer repeat sequence repeat instructions that follow the asterisk as many times as stated a adore 552 6 x 100g indicates a short repeat sequence repeat instruction in brackets as many times as stated blo back loop only b pure 010 chain s chain/chain stitch es 4 x 100g chain-space chain space cont continue double_crochet us single_crochet double_crochet us single_crochet measurements flo front loop only width x length for finished blanket fltr2d front loop treble 2 down working in front cm 82 x 127 of sts from previous row treble in flo of st in 32¼ x 50 2 row below half_double_crochet us half_double_crochet half treble_crochet us half_double_crochet equipment rs right side 7mm uk 2 crochet hook sl-st us slip_stitch slip_stitch darning needle st s stitch es scissors treble_crochet us double_crochet treble us double_crochet ws wrong side gauge 12 5 sts and 11 row to 10cm 4in measured over wrong side special abbreviations of overlay mosaic pattern using 7mm hook or size required to achieve correct gauge it is essential to work to the stated standing double_crochet beginning with a slip knot on hook hold gauge to ensure success in place work double_crochet into stitch chainless start with ch2 insert hook into bump of pattern notes foundation 2nd st from hook yrh pull through a loop double us single yrh pull through one loop yrh and pull this pattern is written using uk terminology with us crochet through both loops on hook this is your conversions given in brackets in abbreviation list 1st double_crochet for remaining sts insert hook into this crochet blanket uses the overlay mosaic crochet chain st pull through a loop yrh and pull technique in this technique you only work with the right side through one loop yrh and pull through facing you working each row once only this requires you to both loops on hook repeat to end cut and join in new yarn on every row start a new row with standing double_crochet we will add edging at the end to hide all the ends the first 2 and last 2 sts are always worked in double_crochet and indicate the colour you will use for the whole row chunky work each st in back loop only blo and place trebles fltr2d roving when required working trebles into front loops of stitches from first row below of the same colour gauge 140 153 100g 10cm/4″sq this pattern is charted and written however many will find metres yards ball working from the chart is the easiest method 14 sts swor 91 lapland blanket by anna nikipirowicz 100% bluefaced kerry hill 6 5mm 6 5mm us10 5 us10 5 reshape whilst damp do not tumble dry wool/wolle/lana/laine/ull/villa cid 24 cid
